alert.note: Alert for Brevard (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 01 at 9:57AM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, Brevard. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 956 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to persistent thunderstorms moving through the Melbourne area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Palm Bay, Melbourne, Satellite Beach, Malabar, Indialantic, Camp Holly Fish Camp, Merritt Island, West Melbourne, Indian Harbour Beach, Melbourne Beach, South Patrick Shores, Palm Shores, Melbourne Village, June Park, Melbourne Airport, Eau Gallie and Spessard Holland Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
